results.title: The Plains of Heaven
results.brief_description: In this inversion of the buddy-film two technicians manning a tracking station on the High Plains pursue diametrically opposed ways of coping with the isolation. The ageing Cunningham seems to be rejuvenated by and obsessed with the landscape while the younger Barker withdraws into the station and its attendant technology. Return to Barker’s Melbourne becomes a descent into a fragmented, nightmare cityscape. The denial of cause and effect explanations for behaviour invites a metaphysical interpretation of this ambiguously down-side existential drama of disorientation and alienation not dissimilar to Werner Herzog’s visionary dramas although without the German director’s quirky black humour. Cast: Richard Moir, Reg Evans, Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: The Plague [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project, Richard McRoberts and Barry Washington
results.brief_description: A program which provides an analysis of the novel “The Plague” by Albert Camus, some comments on symbolism found in it and some stimulus for further discussion. Discusses the life and philosophy of Camus with reference to the novel; various subject levels of the novel; narrative structure and characters.

results.title: The Place at the coast (Captioned)
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1961, Ellie and her father travel to the seaside town of Kilkee for their annual holiday. For a time, the two enjoy their past routines - Ellie, a keen naturalist, observing and recording the native wildlife, her father fishing. However, a tourist development plan is proposed which will change their summer retreat, and Ellie soon learns that she is alone in her opposition to change. Cast includes John Hargreaves, Heather Mitchell, Tushka Bergen.

results.title: The Pitcairn people
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: A record of the life today of the people of Pitcairn Island, two square miles of volcanic rock in the Pacific, where the mutineers from the Bounty started a new life in 1790.

results.title: The Pirogue maker
results.creator_credit: Humble Oil and Refining Company and Arnold Eagle
results.brief_description: The shaping of a small boat known as a pirogue, from a cypress tree trunk; an intriguing record of a fast-dying art by descendents of the Acadians who left Nova Scotia in 1755. Flaherty’s films “Louisiana story” led to the tracing of one of the few remaining pirogue makers, Hebron Allemand whose work was recorded with Acadian folk songs giving local background.

results.title: The Pirates of Penzance
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Joseph Papp and Wilford Leach
results.brief_description: Frederic (Rex Smith) has been apprenticed to a pirate crew by mistake and when his term finishes he attempts to bring them to justice. Presenting a film adaptation of the classic Gilbert and Sullivan opera with music orchestrated, arranged and conducted by William Elliott, choreography by Graciela Daniele and cast including Kevin Kline (Pirate King), Angela lansbury (Ruth), Linda Ronstadt (Mabel) and George Rose (Major-General).

results.title: The Pirates of Penzance
results.brief_description: Gilbert and Sullivan’s riotous tale of reformed pirates stars Keith Michell and Peter Allen, with the London Symphony Orchestra and Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Considered by some G & S enthusiasts as not a good example of Gilbert and Sullivan at its best.

results.title: The Pirate's gold
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A dying pirate hides treasure in an old woman’s cottage. Many years later, when her son is in great need, it comes to light. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Arthur V. Johnson, Tony O’Sullivan, mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Pipette
results.creator_credit: Australian Teaching Films, Craig Baynes and L.M. Simmons
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films demonstrating the use of chemical apparatus; correct method of using the pipette; cleaning and preparation; filling; adjustment of liquid level to measuring mark; discharging the pipette; washing and cleaning after use.
